1: binge eating is similar to substance abuse in the sense that both are heavily addictive and happen when chemical reactions take over the brain. There are two food hormones: ghrelin and leptin. Grilling makes you hungry and leptin makes you full. Remember this for later! https://t.co/HCz8eCYjfB

2: or ghrelin hormones rise when your body thinks you need food, + or leptin hormones rise when you‚Äôve had enough food and feel satisfied. Frequent binge eating is most likely due to these hormones not working properly, + so you never feel full at the proper time. https://t.co/DERsSkbmHd

5: binge eating is not just cognitive, but it is also emotional. B.E.D is often a result of unmanaged anxiety, depression, or a trauma response. There are scientific studies that prove the correlation between low self esteem and frequent over-eating to manage those emotions. https://t.co/5PfJfyKppd

10: for those who strictly have a hormone imbalance, there is medication that can be used to make you feel more full. But for most of us, binge eating is primarily emotional, which means the only real way to tackle BED is to confront your own self. https://t.co/7asDoWXNWU

Like reactively eating due to unresolved emotions. Cont‚Äôd: figuring out your triggers boosts the likelihood of preventing a binge! Taking the time to go overtimes in the past where you went on a huge binge and figuring out what triggered you can help you identify it when it https://t.co/NAllKWfQCk
